ground_truth: Vernon lands flat on his back in a bush. He scrambles to his feet and stares angrily after the car as it disappears into the night sky. From the back seat, Ron smiles at his friend. The suburbs are left far behind. As day breaks, the car reaches open countryside. It sweeps down over green fields and trees towards a ramshackle house beside a lake. The car touches down on a narrow sandy track and bumps along it past an outhouse. Two pale pink pigs look up curiously from their sty. Harry's eyes are wide with amazement. The three brothers unlock the door and creep stealthily into the house. Harry looks around the kitchen with delight. A pan scrubber cleans a frying pan which holds itself under a running tap. Ron grabs a bun. Next to an armchair, a pair of needles hang in mid-air knitting a multi-colored garment. A young girl appears. Embarrassed, the girl disappears upstairs. Mr. Weasley joins them at the table. An old grey owl flaps wearily towards the house and hits the window. Percy takes an envelope from the owl's beak. Beside the fireplace, wearing his school cloak, Ron steps into the fireplace and takes a handful of powder. Ron disappears in a flash of green flames. Harry steps forward nervously. Harry takes a handful of powder. Standing in the fireplace, Harry takes a deep breath. Harry disappears in a flash of green flames. Mrs. Weasley looks confused. Harry shoots out of the fireplace onto a dusty wooden floor. He is streaked with soot and ash. He picks up his glasses and puts them on. One of the lenses is broken. He gets up slowly and looks around the gloomy shop, at the glass cabinets covered in cobwebs. They are all piled high with shrunken heads and skulls of all shapes and sizes. Cautiously, he moves towards a shelf and taps idly on a glass dome. Beside it, a skeletal hand with bony black fingers is mounted on a piece of marble. Harry puts his fingers around the bony thumb. The hand suddenly closes, clutching him tightly. He struggles desperately to free himself from its ghastly grip. The hand releases him, and he hurries across the shop towards the open door which leads out into the alley. Outside, he finds himself in a damp, dingy passageway. He passes a suspicious-looking man lurking in the shadows. Suddenly, a sharp-faced witch with a pointed hat grabs him by the arm. He is surrounded. He is terrified. Harry runs towards Hagrid, a giant with bushy hair and a huge black beard. In Diagon Alley, a girl with long wavy hair comes out of a shop and spots them.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Vernon descends flat on his spine in a shrub. He scrambles to his feet and glowers angrily after the automobile as it vanishes into the nocturnal sky. From the rear seat, Ron grins at his companion. The suburbs are left far behind. As dawn breaks, the automobile reaches open countryside. It glides down over verdant fields and trees towards a dilapidated dwelling beside a lake. The automobile touches down on a narrow sandy path and jostles along it past an outbuilding. Two pale pink swine look up curiously from their sty. Harry's eyes are wide with wonder. The three siblings unlock the door and creep stealthily into the dwelling. Harry looks around the kitchen with delight. A pan scrubber cleans a skillet which holds itself under a running spout. Ron grabs a roll. Next to an armchair, a pair of needles suspend in mid-air knitting a multi-hued garment. A young girl appears. Embarrassed, the girl vanishes upstairs. Mr. Weasley joins them at the table. An old grey owl flaps wearily towards the dwelling and hits the window. Percy takes an envelope from the owl's beak. Beside the hearth, wearing his school cloak, Ron steps into the fireplace and takes a handful of powder. Ron vanishes in a burst of green flames. Harry steps forward nervously. Harry takes a handful of powder. Standing in the fireplace, Harry takes a deep breath. Harry vanishes in a burst of emerald flames. Mrs. Weasley looks perplexed. Harry shoots out of the fireplace onto a dusty wooden floor. He is streaked with soot and ash. He picks up his spectacles and puts them on. One of the lenses is fractured. He gets up slowly and looks around the dim shop, at the glass cabinets covered in cobwebs. They are all piled high with shrunken heads and craniums of all shapes and sizes. Cautiously, he moves towards a shelf and taps idly on a glass dome. Beside it, a skeletal hand with bony black digits is mounted on a piece of marble. Harry puts his fingers around the bony thumb. The hand suddenly closes, clutching him tightly. He struggles frantically to free himself from its ghastly grip. The hand releases him, and he hurries across the shop towards the open door which leads out into the alley. Outside, he finds himself in a damp, dingy passageway. He passes a suspicious-looking man lurking in the shadows. Suddenly, a sharp-faced witch with a pointed hat grabs him by the arm. He is surrounded. He is terrified. Harry runs towards Hagrid, a giant with bushy hair and a huge black beard. In Diagon Alley, a girl with long wavy tresses comes out of a shop and spots them.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Vernon is landed flat on his back in a bush. To his feet, he is scrambled, and he is stared at angrily by him after the car as it disappears into the night sky. From the back seat, his friend is smiled at by Ron. The trio leaves the suburbs far behind. As day breaks, open countryside is reached by the car. It is swept down over green fields and trees towards a ramshackle house beside a lake. A narrow sandy track is touched down on by the car, which bumps along it past an outhouse. Two pale pink pigs look up curiously from their sty. Amazement is displayed in Harry's wide eyes. The door is unlocked by the three brothers, who creep stealthily into the house. Delight is found by Harry as he looks around the kitchen. A frying pan is cleaned by a pan scrubber which holds itself under a running tap. A bun is grabbed by Ron. Next to an armchair, a multi-colored garment is knitted by a pair of needles that hang in mid-air. A young girl appears. The girl, embarrassed, disappears upstairs. The table is joined by Mr. Weasley. The house is approached wearily by an old grey owl, which hits the window. An envelope is taken from the owl's beak by Percy. Beside the fireplace, wearing his school cloak, Ron steps into the fireplace and takes a handful of powder. In a flash of green flames, Ron disappears. Nervously, Harry steps forward. A handful of powder is taken by Harry. Standing in the fireplace, a deep breath is taken by Harry. In a flash of green flames, Harry disappears. Confusion is shown by Mrs. Weasley. Harry is shot out of the fireplace onto a dusty wooden floor. Soot and ash streak him. His glasses are picked up and put on by him. One of the lenses is broken. Slowly, he gets up and looks around the gloomy shop, at the glass cabinets covered in cobwebs. Shrunken heads and skulls of all shapes and sizes pile them high. Cautiously, he moves towards a shelf and taps idly on a glass dome. Mounted on a piece of marble beside it is a skeletal hand with bony black fingers. His fingers are put around the bony thumb by Harry. Suddenly, the hand closes, clutching him tightly. Desperately, he struggles to free himself from its ghastly grip. The hand releases him, and across the shop towards the open door which leads out into the alley, he hurries. In a damp, dingy passageway, he finds himself outside. A suspicious-looking man lurking in the shadows is passed by him. Suddenly, his arm is grabbed by a sharp-faced witch with a pointed hat. He surrounds him. Terror fills him. Harry runs towards Hagrid, a giant with bushy hair and a huge black beard. A girl with long wavy hair comes out of a shop in Diagon Alley and spots them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Vernon lands on his back in a bush, scrambles up, and glares after the car disappearing into the night. Ron smiles at him from the back seat as they leave the suburbs behind. By daybreak, the car reaches open countryside, gliding over fields towards a ramshackle house by a lake. Landing on a narrow track, they pass an outhouse where pigs look up curiously. Harry is amazed. The three brothers quietly enter the house. Harry delights in the kitchen where a pan cleans itself and Ron grabs a bun. Needles knit a colorful garment. A young girl appears but leaves embarrassed. Mr. Weasley joins them as an old owl hits the window, giving Percy a letter. Ron steps into the fireplace, takes powder, and disappears in green flames. Nervously, Harry follows. Mrs. Weasley looks bewildered. Harry emerges on a dusty floor, covered in soot, with broken glasses. He examines the shop's cobweb-covered glass cabinets filled with shrunken heads and skulls. He taps a glass dome, and a skeletal hand trapped inside grips him tightly before releasing him. Harry escapes into a damp passageway, passing a lurking man. A sharp-faced witch grabs him, leaving him terrified. Harry runs to Hagrid, a giant with bushy hair and beard. In Diagon Alley, a girl with long wavy hair spots them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Vernon lands in a bush and angrily watches the car vanish into the night. In it, Ron smiles as they leave the suburbs. At dawn, the car reaches the countryside, landing near a ramshackle house by a lake. Harry, amazed, sees the house's charm. A pan scrubber cleans a frying pan under a tap while Ron eats a bun. Knitting needles float mid-air, crafting a colorful garment. A young girl appears and quickly retreats upstairs. Mr. Weasley joins them, and an old owl hits the window. Percy takes an envelope from its beak. By the fireplace, Ron uses a handful of powder to vanish in green flames. Harry, nervous, repeats this and disappears. Mrs. Weasley looks puzzled. Harry emerges onto a dusty floor, covered in soot, with broken glasses. In a dim shop, surrounded by cobweb-covered cabinets of shrunken heads and skulls, he taps a glass dome. A skeletal hand grips him tightly until he breaks free, rushing out to a damp alley. There, a sharp-faced witch grabs him. Terrified, Harry runs to Hagrid in Diagon Alley, where a girl with wavy hair spots them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Vernon finds himself landing flat on his back directly in a prickly bush. With a swift and determined motion, he scrambles upright, his eyes filled with anger as he glares at the car disappearing swiftly into the night sky above. From inside the rear seat, Ron grins warmly at his friend. The familiar suburbs are soon left far behind them as they venture onward. As the first light of daybreak begins to paint the horizon, the car arrives at the serene open countryside. It gracefully sweeps down over expansive green fields and leafy trees until it reaches a ramshackle, somewhat dilapidated house situated beside a tranquil lake. The magical car touches down gently on a narrow, sandy track, bumping along the path as it passes by a small outhouse. Two pale pink pigs, resting comfortably in their sty, look up with curiosity at the unusual sight. 

Harry's eyes are wide open with amazement and wonder. The three brothers quietly unlock the door and creep stealthily into the welcoming house. Harry looks around the cozy kitchen with joy and delight. A pan scrubber, as if by magic, begins to clean a frying pan which subsequently holds itself under a running tap of water. Ron seizes the moment to grab a bun. Near an inviting armchair, a pair of knitting needles hang mid-air, busily crafting a multi-colored garment. A young girl then appears, but feeling embarrassed, she disappears swiftly upstairs. Mr. Weasley joins them all at the table with an inviting demeanor. Just then, an old gray owl flaps wearily in the direction of the house and collides gently with the window. Percy promptly takes an envelope from the owl's beak. 

Beside the fireplace, clad in his school cloak, Ron confidently steps into the fireplace and takes a handful of powder. In an instant, Ron vanishes in a flash characterized by bright green flames. Harry steps forward with a touch of nervousness. With courage, Harry also takes a handful of powder. Standing firmly in the fireplace, Harry takes a deep, calming breath. He, too, disappears in a similar flash of vivid green flames. Mrs. Weasley watches with a slightly confused expression. Harry then shoots out of the fireplace, landing on a dusty wooden floor. He is covered in a streak of soot and ash. Slowly, he picks up his glasses and places them on his face, noticing one of the lenses is unfortunately broken.

After rising slowly, he takes a good look around the gloomy, eerie shop, observing the glass cabinets cloaked in cobwebs. They are piled high with an assortment of shrunken heads and skulls of various shapes and sizes. Cautiously, he approaches a nearby shelf and taps idly on a glass dome. Situated beside it, a skeletal hand with long, bony black fingers is mounted on a piece of marble. With some hesitation, Harry wraps his fingers around the bony thumb. Suddenly, the hand closes tightly, clutching him with a fierce grip. Harry struggles desperately to free himself from the ghastly clutch. Once released, he hurries across the shop towards the open door that leads out into the alley. Once outside, he finds himself in a damp and dingy passageway. As he cautiously proceeds, he passes a suspicious-looking man lurking silently in the shadows. Without warning, a sharp-faced witch wearing a pointed hat grabs him firmly by the arm. Surrounded and feeling immensely terrified, Harry runs in the opposite direction and finds Hagrid, a giant of a man with bushy hair and a formidable black beard. In bustling Diagon Alley, a girl with long, wavy hair emerges from a shop and spots them quickly.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Vernon unexpectedly finds himself landing flat on his back, directly in the middle of a prickly bush. With a swift yet determined motion, he scrambles upright, his eyes blazing with anger as he glares intently at the car that is disappearing swiftly into the dark night sky above him. From inside the rear seat, Ron offers a warm, reassuring grin to his friend. The familiar and comforting suburbs are soon left far behind them as they venture onward with anticipation. As the first light of daybreak begins to paint the horizon with soft hues, the car gracefully arrives at the serene open countryside. It sweeps elegantly down over expansive, lush green fields and leafy, flourishing trees until it reaches a ramshackle, somewhat dilapidated house that is situated beside a tranquil, mirror-like lake. The magical car touches down gently on a narrow, sandy track, bumping along the path as it passes by a small, weathered outhouse. Two pale pink pigs, resting comfortably in their sty, look up with curiosity at the unusual sight flying past.

Harry's eyes are wide open, filled with amazement and wonder at the scene unfolding before him. The three brothers quietly unlock the door and creep stealthily into the warm, welcoming house. Harry looks around the cozy kitchen with joy and delight, his heart swelling at the sight. To his amazement, a pan scrubber, as if by magic, begins to clean a frying pan, which subsequently positions itself under a running tap of water. Ron seizes this moment of activity to grab a bun and take a bite. Near an inviting armchair, a pair of knitting needles hang mid-air, busily crafting a multicolored garment with rhythmic precision. A young girl then appears, but overcome by embarrassment, she swiftly disappears upstairs. Mr. Weasley joins them all at the table, his demeanor inviting and amiable. Just then, an old gray owl flaps wearily in the direction of the house and collides gently with the window, causing a soft thud. Percy promptly takes an envelope from the owl's beak with practiced ease.

Beside the fireplace, clad in his school cloak, Ron confidently steps into the sooty fireplace and takes a handful of powder. In an instant, he vanishes in a dramatic flash characterized by bright green flames. Harry steps forward with a touch of nervousness mixed with determination. With courage bolstering his spirits, Harry also takes a handful of the powder. Standing firmly in the fireplace, Harry takes a deep, calming breath to steady himself. He, too, disappears in a similar flash of vivid, bright green flames. Mrs. Weasley watches with a slightly puzzled expression adorning her face. Harry then shoots out of the fireplace, landing with a thud on a dusty wooden floor. He is covered in a streak of soot and ash, evidence of his journey. Slowly, he picks up his glasses and places them on his face, noticing with disappointment that one of the lenses is unfortunately broken.

After rising slowly and gathering his composure, he takes a good look around at the gloomy, eerie shop, his eyes observing the glass cabinets cloaked in a veil of cobwebs. They are piled high with an assortment of grotesque shrunken heads and various skulls of different shapes and sizes. Cautiously, he approaches a nearby shelf and taps idly on a glass dome that catches his eye. Situated beside it, a skeletal hand with long, bony black fingers is mounted on a piece of marble, casting an ominous presence. With some hesitation, Harry wraps his fingers around the bony thumb, curious yet fearful. Suddenly, the hand closes tightly, clutching him with a fierce and unforgiving grip. Harry struggles desperately to free himself from the ghastly clutch that holds him. Once released, he hurries across the shop towards the open door that leads ominously out into the alley. Once outside, he finds himself in a damp and dingy passageway. As he cautiously proceeds, he passes by a suspicious-looking man lurking silently in the shadows, evoking a sense of unease in him. Without warning, a sharp-faced witch wearing a pointed hat grabs him firmly by the arm, her grip unyielding. Surrounded and feeling immensely terrified, Harry runs in the opposite direction, relieved when he finally finds Hagrid, a giant of a man with bushy hair and a formidable black beard. In the bustling Diagon Alley, a girl with long, wavy hair emerges from a shop, her eyes quickly spotting them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Vernon lands heavily and unceremoniously flat on his back amidst the scratchy leaves and branches of a bush, the impact momentarily stunning him before he hastily scrambles back upright to his feet. Gathering his bearings, he directs his furious gaze after the rapidly vanishing car, watching with frustration and disbelief as it ascends higher and fades away into the cloaking darkness of the night sky. Meanwhile, seated comfortably in the back seat with a content smile on his face, Ron casts a glance at his companion, reveling in the adventure as the distant lights of the suburbs disappear far behind them. As the first rays of dawn gently break through the horizon, painting the sky with soft hues of morning light, the car glides seamlessly into the peaceful expanse of the open countryside. It swoops down gracefully, skimming over patches of lush green fields dotted with trees, and approaches a ramshackle house nestled picturesquely beside a shimmering lake. The car gently alights on a narrow, sandy track and begins to bump along the uneven surface, jostling its passengers slightly as it passes by a quaint outhouse. Curiously, two pale pink pigs lift their heads from their sty, intrigued by the unexpected disturbance. Inside the car, Harry’s eyes widen in awe at the unfolding scene. Upon reaching their destination, the three brothers discreetly unlock the door of the house and stealthily make their way inside, ensuring their entry is as quiet as possible. Harry glances around the kitchen, his face alight with delight as he takes in the magical scene. Observing the animated spectacle, he watches a pan scrubber energetically scrubbing a frying pan, which dutifully holds itself under a steady stream of water from the tap. Seizing the opportunity for a quick snack, Ron grabs a bun with practiced ease. Nearby, a pair of knitting needles hangs suspended in mid-air, busily crafting a multi-colored garment beside a comfy armchair. Suddenly, a young girl appears in the room but, caught off guard, she quickly retreats upstairs in embarrassment. Shortly thereafter, Mr. Weasley arrives at the table, joining the gathering. Meanwhile, an old grey owl flaps wearily toward the house, coming to an abrupt halt as it collides with the window. Percy retrieves an envelope from the owl's beak. Standing beside the fireplace, Ron, dressed in his school cloak, steps into the hearth and confidently takes a handful of powder, disappearing instantaneously in a flash of brilliant green flames. Stepping forward with a mix of excitement and apprehension, Harry follows Ron's example. Resolutely, he takes a handful of powder, steps carefully into the fireplace, and inhales deeply to steady his nerves before vanishing in a similar burst of green flames. Outside the house, Mrs. Weasley appears momentarily perplexed by the rapid departures. Emerging on the other side, Harry shoots out of the fireplace, landing awkwardly on a dusty wooden floor. Covered in soot and ash, he shakes himself off, picking up his glasses and placing them back on his nose, frowning slightly as he notices that one of the lenses is broken. Rising slowly, he takes a cautious look around the dimly lit shop, noting with a shiver the glass cabinets that are draped in cobwebs and crammed with macabre shrunken heads and skulls of various shapes and sizes. Moving carefully towards a shelf, he idly taps on a nearby glass dome, his attention caught by a skeletal hand with blackened bony fingers mounted ominously on a marble base. Tentatively, he wraps his fingers around the hand’s bony thumb, only to recoil in shock as the hand abruptly closes around his, gripping him with a terrifying, ghastly strength. Panicking, he struggles fiercely to break free from its sinister hold, finally managing to do so and hurriedly retreats across the shop toward the open doorway that offers escape into the alley. Once outside, Harry finds himself standing in a damp, dimly lit passageway, the air heavy with an air of unease. As he makes his way along the passage, he passes a suspicious-looking man who lurks menacingly in the shadows. Suddenly, a sharp-faced witch wearing a pointed hat materializes from the gloom and seizes him firmly by the arm, leaving him surrounded and utterly terrified by the unexpected confrontation. Acting on impulse, Harry bolts towards the reassuring figure of Hagrid, the towering giant with bushy hair and a large black beard, whose presence is both familiar and comforting. As they enter the bustling environment of Diagon Alley, a girl with long, wavy hair emerges from a nearby shop and quickly spots them, her face breaking into a grin at the sight.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Vernon lands flat on his back in a bush, quickly getting to his feet to angrily watch the car vanish into the night sky. From the back seat, Ron smiles at his friend as they leave the suburbs behind and reach open countryside at daybreak. The car sweeps over fields and trees, landing on a narrow track beside a lake, where it bumps along past two curious pigs. Amazed, Harry enters the house with the three brothers, delighting in the kitchen's magical workings, like a pan scrubber cleaning under a tap and needles knitting in mid-air. A young girl appears briefly, embarrassed, and disappears upstairs before Mr. Weasley joins them at the table. An old owl flaps to the window, delivering an envelope Percy retrieves. Wearing his school cloak, Ron steps into the fireplace with a handful of powder and vanishes in green flames. Harry follows suit, though a bit nervously, and also vanishes in green flames while Mrs. Weasley looks confused. Harry emerges onto a dusty shop floor, covered in soot. He retrieves his broken glasses, surveys the cobwebbed shop filled with shrunken heads and skulls, and taps idly on a glass dome beside a skeletal hand. When the hand grips him tightly, he struggles free and hurries to the alley, encountering a suspicious man and a sharp-faced witch who grabs his arm, terrifying him. Harry then rushes toward Hagrid, escaping into Diagon Alley, where a girl with long wavy hair spots them.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Vernon lands flat on his back in a bush, a common privet often found in suburban gardens. He scrambles to his feet and stares angrily after the enchanted car as it disappears into the night sky, a magical vehicle modified to fly. From the back seat, Ron, the red-haired young wizard, smiles at his friend. The suburbs, with their rows of identical houses, are left far behind. As day breaks, the car reaches open countryside, a tranquil area known for its rolling hills and open skies. It sweeps down over green fields and ancient oak trees towards a ramshackle house, the Burrow, beside a shimmering lake reflecting the morning sun. The car touches down on a narrow sandy track and bumps along it past an outhouse covered in ivy. Two pale pink pigs, a common sight on rural farms, look up curiously from their muddy sty. Harry's eyes are wide with amazement at this magical scene. The three brothers, Fred, George, and Ron, unlock the door and creep stealthily into the house. Harry looks around the kitchen with delight at the magical household. A pan scrubber enchanted to work autonomously cleans a frying pan which holds itself under a running tap. Ron grabs a bun from a nearby basket. Next to an armchair, a pair of enchanted knitting needles hang in mid-air knitting a multi-colored garment in bright wool. A young girl, Ginny, appears blushing at being seen in her pajamas. Embarrassed, the girl disappears upstairs to avoid further encounter. Mr. Weasley, a Ministry of Magic employee fascinated by Muggle artifacts, joins them at the table. An old grey owl, Errol, flaps wearily towards the house and hits the window, its journey clearly having been exhausting. Percy, the eldest of the children currently at home, takes an envelope from the owl's beak. Beside the fireplace, wearing his school cloak, Ron steps into the fireplace and takes a handful of Floo powder, a magical substance used for traveling through fireplaces. Ron disappears in a flash of green flames. Harry steps forward nervously, anxious about his first time using the Floo Network. Harry takes a handful of powder. Standing in the fireplace, Harry takes a deep breath. Harry disappears in a flash of green flames, commencing his journey. Mrs. Weasley looks confused, worried that Harry might have mispronounced his destination. Harry shoots out of the fireplace onto a dusty wooden floor, in the infamous Borgin and Burkes shop known for its dark magic items. He is streaked with soot and ash from his tumultuous journey. He picks up his glasses and puts them on. One of the lenses is broken, a casualty of his rough landing. He gets up slowly and looks around the gloomy shop, at the glass cabinets covered in cobwebs filled with sinister objects. They are all piled high with shrunken heads, remnants of dark practices, and skulls of all shapes and sizes. Cautiously, he moves towards a shelf and taps idly on a glass dome. Beside it, a Hand of Glory, a skeletal hand with bony black fingers, is mounted on a piece of marble. Harry, intrigued, puts his fingers around the bony thumb. The hand suddenly closes, clutching him tightly, as the dark magic catches him momentarily. He struggles desperately to free himself from its ghastly grip. The hand releases him, and he hurries across the shop towards the open door which leads out into Knockturn Alley, a notorious area known for its dark magic dealings. Outside, he finds himself in a damp, dingy passageway where few legitimate wizards dare to tread. He passes a suspicious-looking man lurking in the shadows, a common sight in this part of the magical world. Suddenly, a sharp-faced witch with a pointed hat, her appearance adding to the sinister atmosphere, grabs him by the arm. He is surrounded, feeling the danger close in. He is terrified, as he knows he is not in a friendly place. Harry runs towards Hagrid, his half-giant friend with bushy hair and a huge black beard, who is fortunately nearby. In Diagon Alley, the bustling hub of magical commerce, a girl with long wavy hair, Hermione, comes out of a shop and spots them, her face lighting up at the sight of familiar friends.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Vernon lands flat on his back in a bush. He scrambles to his feet and stares angrily after the car as it disappears into the night sky. The hand suddenly closes clutching him tightly. He struggles desperately to free himself from its ghastly grip. The hand releases him and he hurries across the shop towards the open door which leads out into the alley. Outside he finds himself in a damp dingy passageway. He passes a suspiciouslooking man lurking in the shadows. Suddenly a sharpfaced witch with a pointed hat grabs him by the arm. He is surrounded. He is terrified. Harry runs towards Hagrid a giant with bushy hair and a huge black beard. In Diagon Alley a girl with long wavy hair comes out of a shop and spots them.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Vernon lands flat on his back in a bush. He scrambles to his feet and stares angrily after the car as it disappears into the night sky. From the back seat Ron smiles at his friend. The suburbs are left far behind. As day breaks the car reaches open countryside. It sweeps down over green fields and trees towards a ramshackle house beside a lake. The car touches down on a narrow sandy track and bumps along it past an outhouse. Two pale pink pigs look up curiously from their sty. Harry's eyes are wide with amazement. The three brothers unlock the door and creep stealthily into the house. Harry looks around the kitchen with delight. A pan scrubber cleans a frying pan which holds itself under a running tap. Ron grabs a bun. Next to an armchair. a pair of needles hang in midair knitting a multicolored garment. A young girl appears. Embarrassed. the girl disappears upstairs. Mr Weasley joins them at the table. An old grey owl flaps wearily towards the house and hits the window. Percy takes an envelope from the owl's beak. Beside the fireplace wearing his school cloak. Ron steps into the fireplace and takes a handful of powder. Ron disappears in a flash of green flames. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Harry steps forward nervously. Harry takes a handful of powder. Standing in the fireplace Harry takes a deep breath. Harry disappears in a flash of green flames. Mrs Weasley looks confused. Harry shoots out of the fireplace onto a dusty wooden floor. He is streaked with soot and ash. He picks up his glasses and puts them on. One of the lenses is broken. He gets up slowly and looks around the gloomy shop at the glass cabinets covered in cobwebs. They are all piled high with shrunken heads and skulls of all shapes and sizes. Cautiously he moves towards a shelf and taps idly on a glass dome. Beside it a skeletal hand with bony black fingers is mounted on a piece of marble. Harry puts his fingers around the bony thumb. The hand suddenly closes clutching him tightly. He struggles desperately to free himself from its ghastly grip. The hand releases him and he hurries across the shop towards the open door which leads out into the alley. Outside he finds himself in a damp dingy passageway. He passes a suspiciouslooking man lurking in the shadows. Suddenly a sharpfaced witch with a pointed hat grabs him by the arm. He is surrounded. He is terrified. Harry runs towards Hagrid a giant with bushy hair and a huge black beard. In Diagon Alley a girl with long wavy hair comes out of a shop and spots them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gregory flops face-first into a puddle. He darts to his knees and glares furiously after the bicycle as it zooms into the morning mist. From the luggage rack, Andy grins at his pal. The desert is left far behind. As twilight descends, the bicycle reaches vast plains. It glides over golden hills and bushes towards a dilapidated barn beside a river. The bicycle lands on a narrow rocky trail and skids along it past a chicken coop. Two bright blue goats glance up curiously from their pen. Mike's eyes are wide with disbelief. The trio of cousins unlatches the gate and slinks quietly into the barn. Mike glances around the den with wonderment. A broom sweeps a carpet which rolls itself under a running faucet. Andy snatches a donut. Beside a sofa, a pair of scissors hover in mid-air cutting a rainbow-colored quilt. A young boy appears. Shy, the boy retreats downstairs. Mr. Smith joins them at the counter. An ancient red hawk soars lazily towards the barn and bumps the door. Charlie takes a book from the hawk's talon. Beside the bookshelf, wearing his winter jacket, Andy steps onto the doorstep and grabs a handful of sand. Andy disappears in a burst of yellow sparks. Mike steps forward hesitantly. Mike grabs a handful of sand. Standing on the doorstep, Mike inhales deeply. Mike disappears in a burst of yellow sparks. Mrs. Smith looks perplexed. Mike tumbles out of the doorstep onto a gritty cement floor. He is smeared with dust and dirt. He picks up his hat and puts it on. One of the brims is torn. He stands up cautiously and peers around the dim cellar, at the wooden crates covered in vines. They are all stacked high with miniature statues and jars of all colors and sizes. Nervously, he inches towards a barrel and taps absently on a ceramic plate. Next to it, a ceramic claw with shiny green talons is mounted on a slab of granite. Mike wraps his palm around the jagged claw. The claw abruptly snaps shut, trapping him firmly. He wriggles frantically to extricate himself from its eerie clutch. The claw releases him, and he dashes across the cellar towards the ajar window which leads out into the street. Outside, he finds himself in a narrow, shadowy corridor. He passes a dubious-looking woman lurking in the recesses. Abruptly, a stern-faced wizard with a wide-brimmed cap seizes him by the collar. He is encircled. He is petrified. Mike races towards Lance, a titan with matted fur and an enormous white mane. In Wizard's Market, a woman with short curly locks exits a boutique and notices them.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Vernon falls into a bush as Ron smiles from the back seat of a car flying away from the suburbs. At dawn, the car lands by a ramshackle house near a lake. Harry is amazed by the magical household where a pan scrubber cleans a pan, and knitting needles work autonomously. A young girl appears briefly, embarrassed, before disappearing upstairs. Mr. Weasley joins the table, and Ron uses a special powder to vanish in green flames. Harry follows nervously and arrives in a dusty shop, covered in soot. He finds eerie items like shrunken heads and a skeletal hand that grips him tightly before releasing him. Outside, Harry enters a dingy alley, encountering a suspicious man and a sharp-faced witch who grabs him. Terrified, he runs to Hagrid, a giant with a bushy beard. In Diagon Alley, a girl with long wavy hair spots them.
